SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: All requirements emphasize the need for an intuitive, user-friendly interface tailored to users with varying technical abilities, particularly older adults and caregivers.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-007-NFR-002 and P-001-NFR-001 focus on older adults, while P-006-NFR-001 targets caregivers. P-004-NFR-003 introduces adaptability based on user preferences and abilities.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Adaptive and User-Friendly Interface
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall feature an adaptive and intuitive interface, designed to cater to older adults and caregivers with varying technical abilities, ensuring ease of use, minimal learning curve, and customization based on user preferences.

SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: Both requirements address specific functional needs: P-006-FR-004 focuses on offline functionality, while P-004-FR-003 emphasizes ease of participation in virtual events.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-006-FR-004 is for caregivers in remote areas, whereas P-004-FR-003 targets patients participating in virtual social events.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Enhanced Accessibility for Specific Use Cases
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall support offline functionality for caregivers in remote areas and provide one-click join functionality with technical support for patients participating in virtual social events.

Conflicts.Note: P-007-NFR-002 emphasizes simplicity for older adults, while P-006-NFR-001 focuses on quick access for caregivers, potentially leading to interface design trade-offs.
P-004-NFR-003 requires adaptability based on user preferences, while P-006-NFR-001 prioritizes a consistent, quick-access interface for caregivers.
